title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:

10:58 <+sburjan> huh .. done :)  
10:59 <+sburjan> vmassol: did we agreed on putting the download packages attached to the page ?  
11:00 <vmassol> sburjan: yes  
11:00 <mflorea> has quit  
11:00 <+sburjan> do you like the Reader Application page now ?  
11:02 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
11:10 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:11 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Can you help with fixing a build issue?  
11:11 <@sdumitriu> http://hudson.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform-core/6694/consoleText  
11:11 <@sdumitriu> It fails when building the example project for rendering-standalone  
11:11 <@sdumitriu> Works locally  
11:19 <@sdumitriu> The problem is that the xwiki-core-rendering-standalone jar is deployed after the build succeeds, but the example build is between these steps  
11:20 <@sdumitriu> OK, I fixed it by deploying the jar locally without running the integration-tests phase  
11:23 <vmassol> sdumitriu: hmm yes you need to build it once to get it to work I think… we'll need to fix this somehow  
11:41 <+sburjan> vmassol: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Albatross+Skin this page seems it doesn't have an author  
11:41 <vmassol> sburjan: yes normal  
11:41 <vmassol> it has one  
11:41 <vmassol> "XWiki Development Team"  
11:41 <vmassol> that's an exception :)  
11:42 <vmassol> because it was developed and supported by the xwiki dev team in the past  
11:42 <vmassol> but has been retired  
11:42 <vmassol> and is no longer supported by the xwiki dev team  
11:42 <+sburjan> I understand  
11:42 <+sburjan> but I was refering to the actual xar/xml  
11:42 <+sburjan> Created by on 2007/12/03  
11:42 <+sburjan> this is what I get in the footer  
11:43 <vmassol> yes  
11:43 <vmassol> it's probably  
11:43 <vmassol> because we had issues with revisions in the past  
11:43 <vmassol> so they start at 14.1 here  
11:43 <vmassol> but you should create a jira issue  
11:43 <vmassol> so that the author of the first exisitng rev is used  
11:43 <vmassol> rather than the one for 1.1  
11:44 <vmassol> (I think that's probably what is happening)  
11:44 <vmassol> you should test it  
11:44 <vmassol> create revs in a doc ('locally)  
11:44 <vmassol> and remove the first rev  
11:44 <vmassol> then check if the author is displayed for the doc  
11:45 <+sburjan> hmm okay  
11:45 <+sburjan> but I guess this can be fixed on that page, right ? :)  
11:45 <+sburjan> and I guess by revision you mean versions  
11:45 <vmassol> maybe but I'd say it's dangerous  
11:45 <vmassol> so no  
11:46 <+sburjan> but to fix this we only have to put something in the <author></author> field, right ?  
11:46 <+sburjan> or the implications are higher  
11:47 <vmassol> hmm  
11:47 <vmassol> you're right actually  
11:47 <vmassol> it shouldn't be related to revs  
11:47 <+sburjan> maybe during the years with imports exports lost it's author (maybe, I'm not sure)  
11:50 <+sburjan> but I'll test the revision/versions issue just to be sure  
11:53 <camaritei> has joined #xwiki  
11:55 <+sburjan> vmassol:  http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Bibsonomy+Macro this extension doesn't have a XAR attached, and it also has an Velocityerror which I'm not able to fix. What can I do ?  
11:56 <vmassol> checking  
11:56 <+sburjan> the download link point to an external wiki which has no content, no xar  
11:56 <Menso> has joined #xwiki  
11:56 <+sburjan> \*points  
11:57 <vmassol> tmortagne: we really have a pb with teh code macro  
11:57 <vmassol> using language = none sburjan for now  
11:57 <+sburjan> okay  
11:57 <+sburjan> vmassol: thanks for fixing it  
11:58 <+sburjan> without the download link, it's useless ... it doesn't seem maintained anymore  
11:58 <@sdumitriu> We should increase the default permsize in start\_xwiki.sh  
11:58 <vmassol> sburjan: oanat was supposed to contact them  
11:58 <vmassol> you can check with her  
11:58 <@sdumitriu> If I install the IRCBot app in the wiki, it quickly fails  
11:58 <+tmortagne> what was the language used ?  
11:58 <vmassol> tmortagne: auto discovery  
11:59 <+tmortagne> problem with auto is that it's given to all parsers to find the right one so for such a big content it's not the best  
12:00 <@cjdelisle> I smell a hack coming.  
12:00 <vmassol> still sholdn't fail with an exception  
12:00 <vmassol> (tmortagne)  
12:00 <+tmortagne> what was the exception ?  
12:00 <@cjdelisle> parse the first 100 lines?  
12:00 <vmassol> maye it's using more permgen  
12:00 <vmassol> as sdumitriu suggested  
12:01 <vmassol> tmortagne: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/viewrev/Extension/Bibsonomy+Macro?rev=20.1  
12:01 <vmassol> Caused by: Traceback (most recent call last):  
12:01 <vmassol>   File "<string>", line 1, in <module>  
12:01 <vmassol>   File "\_\_pyclasspath\_\_/pygments/\_\_init\_\_.py", line 86, in highlight  
12:01 <vmassol>   File "\_\_pyclasspath\_\_/pygments/\_\_init\_\_.py", line 66, in format  
12:01 <vmassol>   File "\_\_pyclasspath\_\_/pygments/\_\_init\_\_.py", line 66, in format  
12:01 <vmassol>   File "\_\_pyclasspath\_\_/pygments/formatters/xdom.py", line 48, in format  
12:01 <vmassol>   File "\_\_pyclasspath\_\_/pygments/style.py", line 80, in style\_for\_token  
12:01 <vmassol> KeyError: Token.Literal.String.Regexp  
12:01 <vmassol> at org.python.core.PyException.fillInStackTrace(PyException.java:70)  
12:01 <vmassol> at java.lang.Throwable.<init>(Throwable.java:181)  
12:01 <vmassol> at java.lang.Exception.<init>(Exception.java:29)  
12:01 <vmassol> at java.lang.RuntimeException.<init>(RuntimeException.java:32)  
12:01 <vmassol> at org.python.core.PyException.<init>(PyException.java:46)  
12:01 <+tmortagne> does not looks like a permgen issue  
12:02 <+tmortagne> more a bug in pygments or jython  
12:03 <+tmortagne> maybe that would be fixed by jython 2.5.2RC2 (we have the beta2 on xwiki.org)  
12:04 <vmassol> tmortagne: maybe you could try it locally  
12:04 <vmassol> (that example)  
12:05 <+tmortagne> actually pygments, jython or our xdom python formatter (i seen it listed in the error but i'm not jythong stack trace expert)  
12:05 <+tmortagne> sure  
12:06 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: wdym IRC app quickly fails ?  
12:07 <@cjdelisle> vmassol, Replied to your mail this morning, I'm interested to know how long you expect XWikiDocument to be the representation of the document?  
12:08 <@sdumitriu> I mean loading the pircbot jar fills the PermGen space  
12:08 <+sburjan> vmassol: what should we do with this : http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Blog+Archives+Macro .. no attachment, no download button. It seems oboslete  
12:08 <@sdumitriu> It's not the problem of the application, but of the default jvm settings  
12:09 <+sburjan> I see  
12:12 <vmassol> sburjan: the macro is there  
12:12 <vmassol> there's no need for a download button  
12:12 <vmassol> not sure what the problem is, we should keep it  
12:12 <+sburjan> ok  
12:12 <+sburjan> next issue : http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Iframe+Macro and http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Iframe+Navigation+Macro seems they are duplicate  
12:13 <vmassol> they're different AFAICS  
12:18 <+sburjan> still wondering why we keep really really obsolete extensions  
12:22 <vmassol> sburjan: for marketing reasons  
12:22 <vmassol> :)  
12:23 <@sdumitriu> OK, hudson builds are working again  
12:23 <vmassol> just joking  
12:23 <vmassol> there are people out there using old versions of XE  
12:23 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: They're also good code snippets  
12:23 <vmassol> including version 0.9.840!  
12:23 <vmassol> (found one 2 months ago)  
12:23 <vmassol> yes sdumitriu is right, they're good examples of what can be done and how to do it  
12:24 <+sburjan> oh.. okay. you know better :)  
12:24 <+sburjan> but if nobody can use them, the users will be frustrated and think out site is broken  
12:24 <+sburjan> I will be back in 30  
12:24 <vmassol> sburjan: we don't control quality of contributed stuff  
12:25 <vmassol> that's why we have the "Developed by the xwiki dev team" certificaztion  
12:25 <+sburjan> I understand  
12:25 <vmassol> we should probably highlight this more though somehow  
12:28 <+sburjan> I understand the idea of community, but we could end up hosting really obsolete and broken things  
12:31 <vmassol> sburjan: and?  
12:31 <vmassol> the only problem is for users not knowing about it that's all  
12:31 <vmassol> that's what the community can bring  
12:31 <vmassol> by editing, commenting, annotating and rating  
12:39 <abusenius> has quit  
12:42 <+tmortagne> vmassol: re http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/viewrev/Extension/Bibsonomy+Macro?rev=20.1 it's a bug in the Python code it seems, probably in our xdom.py, i will try to debug that  
12:42 <+tmortagne> creating a jira issue to start  
12:43 <vmassol> tmortagne: ok  
13:24 <+tmortagne> vmassol: "good" news, that's a Pygments bug and not a Jython issue for once, trying to find how or workaround it  
13:24 <vmassol> tmortagne: ok… there's no version of pygment with a fix?  
13:24 <+sburjan> afaik we use the latest  
13:25 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
13:25 <+tmortagne> vmassol: we are using the last one  
13:25 <vmassol> k  
13:26 <+tmortagne> i will report it to them if not already fixed on trunk and i'm sure they will fix it, they usually answer quickly  
13:26 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
13:27 <@sdumitriu> We should add support for velocity syntax  
13:27 <vmassol> sdumitriu: we need mixed syntax actually  
13:37 <vmassol> sdumitriu: teh reelase notes is pretty poor for 2.7RC1  
13:37 <vmassol> I think there's mor  
13:37 <vmassol> more  
13:38 <vmassol> we've already sent the announcement though  
13:38 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: What more?  
13:38 <vmassol> the points I've added , I'm still adding more  
13:38 <vmassol> this one too: http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-5648  
13:38 <@sdumitriu> I looked at the issues and all are minor improvements and bugfixes  
13:38 <vmassol> I've pinged jerome to edit the release notes about it  
13:39 <vmassol> I've added unc support + new REST feature  
13:39 <vmassol> still cehcking  
13:41 <vmassol> for developers  maybe "Add support for redirect in the register action"  
13:42 <vmassol> not important though  
13:42 <vmassol> this one too for devs: New script service for XML manipulation  
13:43 <vmassol> would need to be documented somewhere btw  
13:43 <vmassol> maybe in the XML Module in extensions  
13:43 <vmassol> (the module will need to be created)  
13:43 <vmassol> hmmm actuzally it's more for the DevGuide  
13:52 <ralucaM> has quit  
13:56 <+sburjan> vmassol: sent email to  Yishay Mor  
13:56 <vmassol> ok  
13:59 <+sburjan> can someone fix http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Albatross+Skin . It has a null <creator>  
14:00 <vmassol> sburjan: yo could raise a jira issue to display "unknown" when the creator is unknown rather than ""  
14:01 <vmassol> \*Unkown  
14:01 <+sburjan> okay. I guess this is also CORE  
14:01 <vmassol> or Unknow, User or something like that  
14:01 <vmassol> yes  
14:01 <+sburjan> ok. but can you fix that page ?  
14:01 <vmassol> busy, but you can do it  
14:12 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
14:12 <jvelo> Hi tmortagne  
14:12 <jvelo> just followed http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/DistributedEventClusterSetup  
14:13 <+tmortagne> jvelo: hi  
14:13 <jvelo> it's straitghforward, except the end, it would benefit from a test method to verify the communication is OK  
14:13 <jvelo> what cache/methid can I use to verify my setup quickly ?  
14:14 <+tmortagne> jvelo: load a page in both instances  
14:14 <+tmortagne> modify it on one  
14:15 <+tmortagne> reload it on the other  
14:15 <+tmortagne> check if it changed  
14:15 <+tmortagne> i.e. check if the this document has been invalidated in the cache  
14:15 <+sburjan> vmassol: honestly I don't know ehre to modify in order to add a creator  
14:16 <+tmortagne> but yes you are right would be good to indicate in the tutorial this way to test if all is ok  
14:16 <jvelo> tmortagne: re "check if the this document has been invalidated in the cache" how do I do that ?  
14:16 <+tmortagne> jvelo: "check if the this document has been invalidated in the cache" is the technical explanation of what you are checking when you do what I indicated  
14:17 <+tmortagne> forget this line, it's was a FYI  
14:17 <jvelo> tmortagne: ok :)  
14:17 <florinciu> has joined #xwiki  
14:20 <+sburjan> XWIKI-5811  
14:21 <jvelo> tmortagne: OK I could verify it does not work yet :)  
14:21 <jvelo> thanks  
14:22 <+sburjan> vmassol: nice CORE commit :)  
14:22 <vmassol> yeah a bit large but I like to refactor things to not add to the debt when I comit ;)  
14:23 <+sburjan> +1 for that attitude :)  
14:24 <jvelo> tmortagne: can I add some debug on the package org.xwiki.observation.remote, will it be useful ?  
14:25 <+tmortagne> jvelo: yep there is a lot of debug log either in org.xwiki.observation.remote or in jgroups package if you want to go deeper  
14:25 <+tmortagne> depends what you are searching  
14:27 <+sburjan> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Architecture this has no creator also  
14:28 <vmassol> sburjan: hint, in preview mode, execute some velocity script to set the author  
14:28 <vmassol> (creator)  
14:28 <+sburjan> okay ... I'll try  
14:28 <vmassol> Im in a meeting right now  
14:28 <+sburjan> ok  
14:28 <vmassol> for the coming 2 hours  
14:28 <+tmortagne> jvelo: maybe your issue is http://community.jboss.org/wiki/IPv6  
14:48 <melvin> has joined #xwiki  
14:50 <melvin> Hi. how can i escape special chars in ldap group mapping? we have Groupnames with spaces in it?  
14:53 <+tmortagne> melvin: spaces are not special chars in ldap groups mapping AFAIK  
14:55 <+tmortagne> but you should try to not use spaces in XWiki groups names (it's ok for ldap groups names) because it's not always very well supported depending of the context (not in ldap authenticator but more in rights or XWiki groups management)  
14:55 <melvin> i tryed this: 'XWiki.XWiki TROX LN'  XWiki.XWiki\ TROX\ LN and XWiki.XWiki+TROX+LN  
14:56 <ralucaM> has joined #xwiki  
14:56 <melvin> second, Ldap Groups have '#' like so: ou=#NPSGRUPPEN,o=TROXGROUP  
14:57 <melvin> i escape these with \\: XWiki.XWikiAdminGroup=cn=pm\_ug\_st,ou=\\#NPSGRUPPEN,o=TROXGROUP  
14:57 <melvin> works for the first mapping, but if the second xwiki group have spaces in it, it doesn't work.  
14:59 <+tmortagne> melvin: let me check the code but at LDAP authenticator level the only special chars are | and the first = between each |  
14:59 <+tmortagne> what do you mean by "it doesn't work" exactly ?  
15:01 <+tmortagne> btw same thing for # i don't see any reason to escape it  
15:02 <melvin> i get this: 2010-12-17 15:01:34,194 [https://localhost:8443/xwiki/wiki/intranet/skin/resources/js/xwiki/table/livetable.js] DEBUG ldap.XWikiLDAPConnection        - LDAP Search failed  
15:02 <melvin> LDAPLocalException: Invalid value in escape sequence "#" (87) Filter Error  
15:03 <melvin> THIS IS THE MAPPING: http://paste.debian.net/102605/  
15:03 <melvin> ups, sorry  
15:07 <+tmortagne> melvin: you mean http://paste.debian.net/102605/ without the \\ ?  
15:08 <melvin> i paste the complete error message  
15:10 <melvin> http://paste.debian.net/102606/ i used to \\ to escape the '#' because without the escaping the first mapping didn't work. with this mapping the first mapping works. adding a second and third mapping brings the exception code  
15:12 <+tmortagne> melvin: according the the error it seems like what is causing the issue is you escaping, the message is saying that # is not supposed to be escaped if I understood it well  
15:12 <+tmortagne> what happen without the escaping ?  
15:13 <+tmortagne> hmm  
15:14 <melvin> i redeploy  
15:14 <+tmortagne> can you paste the full log of the authentication of one user ?  
15:14 <+tmortagne> and your configuration  
15:14 <camaritei> has quit  
15:15 <melvin> ok. do i have to delete the cookie before?  
15:16 <silviar1> has joined #xwiki  
15:16 <+tmortagne> no, cookie is used only for auto authentication  
15:16 <silviar> has quit  
15:17 <melvin> i have a basic auth in front of the wiki  
15:17 <+tmortagne> just select all the log to get after you tried to log in so that i get everything that happen after to clicked on the button  
15:17 <arkub> has quit  
15:17 <sabageru> has quit  
15:17 <+tmortagne> ok  
15:17 <+tmortagne> then just go to a page  
15:17 <camaritei> has joined #xwiki  
15:18 <+tmortagne> basically i would like to get all the log for one authentication try  
15:18 <+tmortagne> restart and access a page should do it  
15:18 <+tmortagne> i mean restart, reset the log and access a page  
15:20 <+tmortagne> in any case i think there is a bug since you should  not have to take care of escaping things for LDAP query, it means that the authentication itself is missing some escaping  
15:24 <sburjan> has quit  
15:25 <melvin> http://paste.debian.net/102608/  
15:26 <melvin> i create a long log as described.  
15:26 <melvin> it seams the uid is NULL if i don't escape the #  
15:30 <sabageru> has joined #xwiki  
15:31 <+tmortagne> # is indeed a special LDAP query char but it should be escaped by the authenticator when needed and not by you, that's a bug  
15:32 <+tmortagne> i'm afraid it will be hard to make it work for you without fixing the bug  
15:32 <+tmortagne> what version of XWiki are you using ?  
15:32 <melvin> from the start: http://paste.debian.net/102610/  
15:33 <melvin> its xwiki 2.5.1  
15:33 <melvin> enterprise version with wiki farm modus  
15:33 <+tmortagne> at least looks like authentocation is working if not groups membership  
15:34 <melvin> yes. auth for user works but groupmapping don't  
15:35 <+tmortagne> melvin: would be great if you could create an issue on http://jira.xwiki.org about group membership and # char and i will work on it  
15:35 <melvin> any chance to escape it somehow to get it working?  
15:35 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
15:36 <+tmortagne> melvin: seems not if that does not work when you escape the #  
15:36 <+tmortagne> could you produce a new log with # escaped this time ?  
15:37 <+tmortagne> so that i check what is not working when you escape it yourself  
15:37 <melvin> ok  
15:38 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
15:40 <melvin> the first mapping works. but aftwer taht, the other mapings sema to fail  
15:41 <melvin> the start: http://paste.debian.net/102611/  
15:42 <melvin> it fetches groups. but later than the mappings fail  
15:42 <melvin> so why works the first mapping  
15:43 <+tmortagne> you means it's working the first time you logs in and it fail other times ?  
15:44 <melvin> yes. my account is mapped to the admin group  
15:45 <+tmortagne> would you have a log when it's failing ?  
15:45 <melvin> but the following mappings doen't work  
15:47 <jvelo> tmortagne: back  
15:47 <jvelo> I've added the JVM option to prefer IPv4  
15:47 <jvelo> but it's not enough  
15:48 <jvelo> I have a doubt though, concerning the channels option  
15:49 <jvelo> tmortagne: the channels I precise in xwiki.properties must correspond to the name of the xml file I put in classes/observation/remote ?  
15:50 <jvelo> tmortagne: actually it's maybe my bind-address in the tcpX.xml that is wrong.. I'm binding on localhost but the 2 tomcats are on separate machines, so I should rather bind on the external address  
15:50 <jvelo> will test this  
15:51 <+tmortagne> jvelo: yes the id is what is used to find the right configuration file name  
15:51 <+tmortagne> yep each one should point to the other  
15:51 <melvin> tmortagne: sorry, i don't have time left. can you report the bug.  
15:52 <+tmortagne> melvin: ok  
15:52 <melvin> so see you next year :-)  
15:53 <melvin> thx a lot for the support

18:22 <vmassol> which has the full API (privilged)
